document.discussion_title: Gun stolen in New Bedford housebreak recovered, 3 arrested
document.topic_text: Gun stolen in New Bedford housebreak recovered, 3 arrested southcoasttoday.com Posted Apr. 25, 2016 @ 1:32 pm Posted Apr. 25, 2016 @ 1:32 pm » Social News DARTMOUTH — New Bedford police arrested two women and a man on breaking and entering warrants Saturday night at the Capri Motel on State Road and recovered a handgun stolen in a housebreak on Allen Street in New Bedford, police said. Katia D. Reboca, 27, of 69 Hall St., New Bedford; Krystle Dawn Fareas, 29, of 25 Salisbury St., New Bedford; and Willie Vinnie, 27, of 108 John St., Fall River, are all charged with a warrant for breaking and entering in the nighttime with intent to commit a felony, according to Detective Capt. Steven Vicente, a spokesman for the New Bedford Police Department. The three are also charged with carrying a firearm without a license, carrying a loaded firearm and unlawful possession of ammunition, according to the New Bedford Police Department logs. Vicente said a .40-caliber semi-automatic handgun was stolen Friday night in a housebreak in the 400-block of Allen Street in New Bedford and the police investigation led officers to the suspects. The gun was inside an unopened metal safe that was found in the trunk of the suspects' vehicle, he said. — Curt Brown
